item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 19, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Have you ever seen soldering this close? [video] (259 points | 41 comments)
2. Is Tor still safe to use? (426 points | 309 comments)
3. Nintendo Files Suit for Infringement of Patent Rights Against Pocketpair, Inc (148 points | 105 comments)
4. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1387 points | 410 comments)
5. Comic Mono (200 points | 61 comments)
6. Debugging Behind the Iron Curtain (2010) (34 points | 1 comment)

8. Ruby-SAML pwned by XML signature wrapping attacks (65 points | 35 comments)

10. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (123 points | 114 comments)
11. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (220 points | 110 comments)

15. A Case Study of Reflex Epilepsy Induced by Playing Chess (11 points | 2 comments)

18. LinkedIn is now using everyone's content to train their AI tool (250 points | 109 comments)

20. A overview of binaries, ELF, and NoMMU on Linux (79 points | 1 comment)
21. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (67 points | 16 comments)
22. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1503 points | 768 comments)
23. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (99 points | 67 comments)
24. iOS 18 breaks IMAPS self-signed certs (52 points | 77 comments)
25. The Dune Shell (182 points | 61 comments)
26. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (40 points | 28 comments)
27. J2ME-Loader: J2ME emulator for Android devices (12 points | discuss)
28. From Myth to Measurement: Rethinking US News and World Report College Rankings (32 points | 31 comments)
29. Text makeup – a tool to decode and explore Unicode strings (39 points | 5 comments)
30. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (75 points | 69 comments)
